details.description: You may need to tell DVLA if you have cardiac problems - download the correct form if you need to let them know
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you have cardiac problems.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. However, you should only restart driving when your doctor says that you are safe to do so. Download the DVLA’s advisory leaflet for car or motorbike drivers with heart conditions for more information.

Download ‘CLE1066 - Car or motorbike drivers with heart conditions’ (PDF, 129KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to the address on the form.

Download ‘VOCH1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 394KB)
